intro: Chelonanthus hamatus, commonly known as the hairy boxthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a woody stem with a distinctive, ribbed appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Chelonanthus hamatus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
